definition: Wang Ming (1904-1974), Soviet trained Chinese communist, Comintern and Soviet stooge and left adventurist in the 1930s, fell out with Mao and moved to Soviet Union from 1956
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
surname Wang
to rule/to reign over
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: As a day laborer, he had no health or disability insurance.
sentences.chinese: 身爲臨時工的王明志沒有醫療或工傷保險。

sentences.english: Oh, Wang Ming, this is she.
Wang Ming has been to a Liu Huan concert in Beijing with more than 2000people .
sentences.chinese: 王明聽過劉歡在北京的音樂會，音樂會有兩千多人。

sentences.english: Wang Mingzi hearing after some hesitation, but still allow down.
sentences.chinese: 王明子聽完後有些猶豫，但還是答應下來。

sentences.english: Glad to see you again, Wang Ming.
sentences.chinese: 很高興再次見到你，王明。

sentences.english: Hello, this is Wang Ming. May I speak to Gao Ling, please?
sentences.chinese: 喂，我是王明，我可以和高玲通話嗎？

sentences.english: I'm Wang Ming from YuWen School, the president of the Student Union.
sentences.chinese: 我是來自育文學校的王明，學生會主席。

sentences.english: Mr Wang Ming, the manager of Xin Cheng Company, came to visit G. M. at 10am.
sentences.chinese: 新城公司經理王明先生上午10點來拜訪總經理。

definition: Otto Braun (1900-1974), Comintern adviser to the Chinese communist party 1932-1939
Chen Yun (1905-1995), communist leader and economist
Zhang Chunqiao (1917-2005), one of the Gang of Four
Chen Boda (1904-1989), communist party theorist, interpreter of Maoism
Zhang Guotao (1897-1979), Chinese communist leader in the 1920s and 1930s, defected to Guomindang in 1938
Kang Sheng (1896-1975), Chinese communist leader, a politburo member during the Cultural Revolution and posthumously blamed for some of its excesses
Wang Hongwen (1935-1992), one of the Gang of Four
Wang Zhen (1908-1993), Chinese political figure
Zhang Wentian (1900-1976), CCP party leader and theorist
Peng Zhen (1902-1997), Chinese communist leader
Xiang Ying (1898-1941), communist general involved in forming the New Fourth Army 新四軍, killed in 1941 during the New Fourth Army incident 皖南事变
Yang Shangkun (1907-1998), former president of PRC and military leader
Yao Wenyuan (1931-2005), one of the Gang of Four
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
Hu Yaobang (1915-1989), Chinese politician
Jiang Qing (1914-1991), Mao Zedong's fourth wife and leader of the Gang of Four
